intro: Cousinia silyboides subsp. silyboides, commonly known as the Kashmiri goatherb, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan region. It is a perennial herb characterized by its hairy, erect stems and basal rosettes of leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in dense, spherical clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to cold, arid conditions. Cousinia silyboides subsp. silyboides is often found in rocky soils and alpine meadows.
